intro: Delosperma zoutpansbergense, commonly known as the Zoutpansberg ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves to survive drought conditions. It typically blooms in spring, producing vibrant pink or purple flowers that attract pollinators. Its compact growth habit and ornamental appearance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
